item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, August 30, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The secret inside One Million Checkboxes (880 points | 68 comments)
2. Bypassing airport security via SQL injection (1390 points | 310 comments)
3. Elasticsearch is open source, again (435 points | 225 comments)
4. Calendar Queues: A Fast O(1) Priority Queue Implementation (1998) (6 points | discuss)
5. I'm blocking connections from AWS to my on-prem services (88 points | 31 comments)
6. Predicting the future of distributed systems (25 points | 3 comments)
7. Google Closure Library has been archived (106 points | 40 comments)
8. SDL3 new GPU API merged (109 points | 42 comments)
9. Chrome is entrenching third-party cookies that will mislead users (334 points | 160 comments)
10. The Thin Purple Line (4 points | discuss)
11. Visit Bletchley Park (60 points | 19 comments)
12. Show HN: Amine – Prevents you from switching 100s of Browser Tabs (46 points | 12 comments)
13. Launch HN: CodeViz (YC S24) – Visual maps of your codebase in VS Code (135 points | 49 comments)
14. Firewall rules: not as secure as you think (85 points | 34 comments)
15. Can solar costs keep shrinking? (268 points | 413 comments)
16. Anthropic's Prompt Engineering Interactive Tutorial (180 points | 27 comments)
17. DuckDuckGo for Mac is now open source (96 points | 27 comments)
18. Raspberry Pi Pico does line rate 100M Ethernet (197 points | 30 comments)
19. Mastering ISO 8583 Message Networking with Golang (27 points | 5 comments)
20. Show HN: A discovery-focused search engine for Hacker News (137 points | 24 comments)
21. Judges rule Big Tech's free ride on Section 230 is over (369 points | 415 comments)
22. Show HN: An open-source, local-first Webflow for your own app (182 points | 44 comments)
23. Launch HN: Patchwork (YC S24) – Automatically add structured logs to your code (82 points | 26 comments)
24. Poly (YC S22) is hiring Rust experts in SF to build "Arc browser for files" ( | hide)
25. How I learned to stop worrying and love userspace networking (150 points | 40 comments)
26. Judge rules $400M algorithmic system illegally denied Medicaid benefits (348 points | 94 comments)
27. Air Con: $1697 for an on/off switch (1782 points | 456 comments)
28. Floating points between zero and one (90 points | 58 comments)
29. Show HN: MinutesLink – AI note taker for online calls (17 points | 5 comments)
30. Early Scenes: Remembering a Childhood in the South Bronx (8 points | 2 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, August 30, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
